result.execSummary:
The defendant Chaz C. Chaffee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED/STAYED.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Paul Winslow Rogosheske, DF: Chaz C. Chaffee appeared.  Court called.  Set for SEH.  All parties have reviewed the PSI.  S/T of Probation Agent Jeunai Boche.  Direct by Attorney Rogosheske.  No objections by the attorneys regarding the PSI.  State makes their recommendation.  Attorney Rogosheske makes argument.  DE makes statement.  Recess at 3:55 p.m. Case recalled at 4:32 p.m. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 on 15CF545 to run concurrent to Ct. 3
- DE sentenced to 5 years Imposed and Stayed with 2 years I/C and 3 years E/S 
- W/S 4 years probation with conditions
- DE sentenced to 6 months in the St. Croix County Jail - stayed
- Court grants huber for work and treatment 
- AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
- DE shall complete treatment, including aftercare, successfully
- DE shall cooperate with any evaluation, assessment and/or correctional program as directed by the DOC or the probation agent and complete any recommended therapy or treatment
- DE shall undergo a psychological/psychiatric evaluation within 60 days and shall follow all recommendations for treatment and shall complete any recommended therapy or treatment
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  If UA testing is required, the same shall be viewed in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex. Additional testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.
- Random testing
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- DE not to possess a firearm
- DE shall not operate any motor vehicle without a valid operator's license
- DE shall attend and participate in the St. Croix Valley Restorative Justice Program
- DE shall complete MRT
- DE shall maintain full-time/part-time employment while on probation/extended supervision
- Defendant to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Anchor Inn Tattoo, Aaron L., WIlliam M. or Joseph T.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- Court costs of $268 for Ct. 1 and $250.00 for the DNA Surcharge
- DE to provide a DNA sample to the St. Croix County Jail
- DE to meet with the payment clerk for a payment plan
- DE to report to probation and the bond remains in effect until the DE has signed up for probation.  Crt does not object to probation being transferred to Minnesota. 
- DE shall pay supervision fees as determined by the DOC
- 20 days to appeal
- Hearing to be scheduled to determine restitution

Ct. 3 in 15CF545
- W/S 3 years probation with conditions
- DE sentenced to 10 months in the St. Croix County Jail - 5 months stayed
- Jail may be served in another county.  DE has until 09/15/17 to make arrangements otherwise DE must report to the St. Croix County Jail on 09/15/2017 by 6:00 p.m.
- Court grants huber for work and treatment 
- AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
- DE shall complete treatment, including aftercare, successfully
- DE shall cooperate with any evaluation, assessment and/or correctional program as directed by the DOC or the probation agent and complete any recommended therapy or treatment
- DE shall undergo a psychological/psychiatric evaluation within 60 days and shall follow all recommendations for treatment and shall complete any recommended therapy or treatment
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  If UA testing is required, the same shall be viewed in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex. Additional testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.
- Random testing
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- DE not to possess a firearm
- DE shall not operate any motor vehicle without a valid operator's license
- DE shall attend and participate in the St. Croix Valley Restorative Justice Program
- DE shall complete MRT
- DE shall maintain full-time/part-time employment while on probation/extended supervision
- Defendant to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Anchor Inn Tattoo, Aaron L., WIlliam M. or Joseph T.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- Court costs of $268 for Ct. 3 and $250.00 for the DNA Surcharge
- DE to provide a DNA sample to the St. Croix County Jail
- DE to meet with the payment clerk for a payment plan
- DE to report to probation and the bond remains in effect until the DE has signed up for probation.  Crt does not object to probation being transferred to Minnesota. 
- DE shall pay supervision fees as determined by the DOC
- 20 days to appeal
- Hearing to be scheduled to determine restitution

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Karl E. Anderson   DF ATTY:  Paul Winslow Rogosheske   DF:  Chaz C. Chaffee appeared. Case called at 1:18 pm. Atty Rogosheske recites agreement. No objection from ADA Anderson.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Counts #1 and #3. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Counts #1 and #3. Counts #2, #4, #5, #6, #7 #8 and #9 read in and dismissed for purposes of restitution. Court orders PSI. km  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 22, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Preliminary hearing at 04-08-2016 11:00 am

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Anchor Inn Tattoo, Aaron L., WIlliam M. or Joseph T.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Not to possess firearms.

No consumption of illegal substances.


Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
